object.name: blackberry.ui.menu
object.comment: The Menu object contains functionality for manipulating menu items for the application.
object.details: The functionality in this object allows you to manipulate the dynamically created menu items for the application. This will not allow you to remove the default menu items for the application. To create a separator simply pass the appropriate parameters into the MenuItem constructor.
object.example:
<script type="text/javascript">
  function loadCustomMenuItemsForPage() {
    if (blackberry.ui.menu.getMenuItems().length > 0) {
      blackberry.ui.menu.clearMenuItems();
    }
    
    var item = new blackberry.ui.menu.MenuItem(false, 1, "Click Me", customMenuItemClick);
    blackberry.ui.menu.addMenuItem(item);         
  }

    function customMenuItemClick() {
      alert("user just clicked me");
    }
</script>

func.name: setDefaultMenuItem
func.comment: Sets which item on the menu should be selected by default.

param.name: item
param.comment: The menu item to set as the default.

func.name: getMenuItems
func.comment: This method will return an array representing the menu items for the screen.
func.details: This will return the dynamically created items not including the Switch Application, Close, and context menu items. Removing a menu item from the resultant array will not remove the menu item from the menu. You must call the removeMenuItem() method to remove a menu.

func.name: clearMenuItems
func.comment: Removes all menu items from the current menu.

func.name: removeMenuItem
func.comment: Removes the specified menu item from the menu.

func.name: addMenuItem
func.comment: Adds the supplied menu item to the menu.

func.name: hasMenuItem
func.comment: determine whether the menu contains the specified MenuItem.

param.name: item
param.comment: The menu item to be checked.
